channel.title: Checking if area is walkable
channel.description:
Hello everyone. I have another question that probably won't be answered.
Does anybody know how to make the player walk automatically in a certain direction that does a check first to see whether the area it wants to walk to is walkable (in other words, if you were to click there and you don't walk there, then return false)?
I know that question may sound complex because I am no good at explaining the situation.
I have tried the code: [code]server.playerHandler.players[playerId].addToWalkingQueue(currentX - 1, currentY);[/code] But that makes the player walk right through walls. This would be okay for things like going through doorways, but it does not suffice for things like firemaking next to a wall.
Any help would be nice. Also, don't post a solution not relevant to my topic. I had that happen a couple times with my previous questions. Thanks.

item.title: Checking if area is walkable
item.dc:creator: @heathtech heathtech
item.description:
@heathtech wrote:

Hello everyone. I have another question that probably won’t be answered.

Does anybody know how to make the player walk automatically in a certain direction that does a check first to see whether the area it wants to walk to is walkable (in other words, if you were to click there and you don’t walk there, then return false)?

I know that question may sound complex because I am no good at explaining the situation.

I have tried the code:

server.playerHandler.players[playerId].addToWalkingQueue(currentX - 1, currentY);

But that makes the player walk right through walls. This would be okay for things like going through doorways, but it does not suffice for things like firemaking next to a wall.

Any help would be nice. Also, don’t post a solution not relevant to my topic. I had that happen a couple times with my previous questions.
Thanks.
